items.text: tossed up on off stump, and he defends off the front foot. But the ball straightened after pitching, and took the bat's inside edge
items.shortText: Aponso to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: full outside off, and he dances down the wicket. Bunts a drive straight down the ground to mid off
items.shortText: Aponso to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: slower through the air, and lands short outside off. He rocks back and tentatively cuts to point
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: full on off, and driven off the front foot to cover. Straight to the fielder
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: wider outside off, and Mushfiqur waits for the ball to get to him. Drives this hard, and manages to find the gap between cover and mid off
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: MahneelMusa: "Gee, it's loud in Dubai, almost like Mirpur. Great vibe!"
items.text: good length outside off, and skidding into the batsman. He rocks onto the back foot, and then defends towards the off side
items.postText:
Nikhil Singh: "Just came to see the score and seeing the scoreboard for scared that the nightmarish English summer has a 6th test match as well. Thankfully it's not India suffering though."

Ali Saqlain: "A much better & aggressive shot by Mushifiqur. Bangladesh needed much of him. As the spinner is on now, both batsmen should take advantage of it and try to rebuild the innings more aggressively."
items.shortText: Aponso to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: goes full first up, and lands just outside off stump. Firmly defended off the front foot
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: dropped again! This time it's Dilruwan at square leg. Full and angling into his pads, and Mushfiqur was enticed enough to clip this off his pads. Straight to Dilruwan, and the ball hits his knee and pops out
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: full on leg stump, and he uses his wrists to whip this behind square on the leg side
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: full outside off stump, and firmly driven to wide mid off. He calls nice and early for the single, and that induces the misfield from the infielder
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: slower ball, but full on off. Mushfiqur doesn't take his eyes off the ball, and defends off the front foot with soft hands
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: full on middle stump, and he shuffles onto the back foot, before nudging this square to the leg side
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: slower through the air, but that allows a big wind-up from the batsman. Drives this hard, and along the ground, but there's a fielder at deep extra cover
items.shortText: Aponso to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: full on off, and defended with the angled bat towards point. Mushfiqur wants one, but Mithun sends him back
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: first real sign of aggression! Full outside off, and he drags a slog-sweep from outside the line and thumps this shot straight into the cow-corner boundary
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.text: tossed up outside off, and Mushfiqur checks a cover drive to Dhanajaya. They scamper across for one
items.postText: Zee: "Just forgive my ignorance , what's the rule for a retired hurt batsman in ODI ? If the batsman is fit to play will he be able to bat again ?" -- Hey! Yes, he may.
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: full on off stump, and carefully defended off the front foot. Soft hands
items.shortText: Aponso to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: drilled over long off! A big over off Aponso. Full and wide outside off, but Mithun comes down the wicket, picks the length up early, and then smacks a shot over the fielder at long off. Outrageous shot!
items.postText: Viduranga: ".bangla nicely rebuilding. What would be a good score @ 20 over mark. 80/2 any thoughts" -- They'll be very happy with that. 250-260 (after 50 overs) is often a good first-innings total here
items.shortText: Aponso to Mohammad Mithun, SIX runs

items.text: full, and aimed at the stumps, and Mushfiqur clips this square to fine leg for one
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: short on off, and he pulls this - along the ground - to the sweeper fielder on the leg side. Slower from Thisara
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: short on off, and he goes for a wild cut-shot over the fielder at point. Done in by the extra pace as the ball bounces over the bat's blade and settles into the gloves of the keeper
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: short outside off, but Mushfiqur rides the bounce, and then pulls this from outside the line of the stumps. Fielder in the deep though
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: good length outside off, and he attempts to steer this off the back foot. But he can't get this fine enough. Stopped by point running forward
items.postText: Sean Daniel: "Not trying to defend our teams poor catching but this raging heat is not easy to cope up with when fielding.. your whole body has to deal with the intensity and your palms could be sweaty making it difficult to hold on.."
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: good length on off, and he uses his bottom hand to whip a safe shot off his hips to the leg side
items.postText:
Kritesh: "Wasnt the last Asia Cup in T-20 format?" -- yep, it rotates depending on how many overs the next World Cup will have. This is a 50-over contest, because the World Cup in 2019 is for ODIs. 
Kanthikiran: "Any score above 270 will bring Bangladesh a win as Sri Lanka don't have the experienced Dinesh Chandimal, remaining batsmen aren't as reliable. "
items.shortText: NLTC Perera to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: full on off, and driven off the front foot to long off for a single
items.shortText: Aponso to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run
